page.title: 04NASSINGTON STABLES.
page.content: The stables were started in April 1983 because the owner wanted to work for herself,with horses,and didn't want to be unemployed. The site covers two acres and she has twelve horses and ponies.There are 12 stables with one large and one small teaching area. There are one hour and half hour lessons in basic dressage and jumping costing five pounds and three pounds.A ride out for one hour is four pounds and fifty pence and escorted rides cost five pounds fifty.There is one full time helper and four part time helpers who come from nearby towns and villages.The people who come to ride are between the ages of five and fifty and are mostly from London,Peterborough Yarwell Mill and all the villages around Nassington.Recently new stables have been built and grazing land acquired in neighbouring villages.
